data.title: Battlefield Earth Saga Year by Ron Hubbard, First Edition
data.meta_description: Battlefield Earth Pt. 1 : A Saga of the Year 3000 by Hubbard, L. Ron and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Glossy Pictorial Card. Condition: Very Good (AVERAGE). No Jacket. Browned paper edges. POSTED AT OUR STANDARD RATES FULLY INSURED! (UK ONLY). FEEL FREE TO E-MAIL FOR PHOTOGRAPHS AND FURTHER DETAILS. FROM A DEALER WHO TELLS YOU WHO THEY ARE AND WHAT THEIR TELEPHONE AND ADDRESS CONTACT DETAILS ARE. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" This is the First Edition of This Editio. Not Signed or Inscribed. MASS MARKET PAPERBACK.

Hardcover. Condition: Fair. Dust Jacket Condition: Fair. First Edition. The jacket is shelf worn with creasing, small closed tears and marks. The boards are edge rubbed with spots and knocked corners. The block is secure. Tearing near the spine between page 342 and 343. Spotting on the early and late pages. No ink inscriptions or annotations. Protected in cellophane. Thick and heavy book, extra postage required unless posted within South Africa. JHK. Our orders are shipped using tracked courier delivery services.

Paperback. Condition: Good+. Gerry Grace (illustrator). First Mass Market Paperback. A good+ reading copy of the 1984 first printing of the mass market paperback edition. This copy is rubbed around the edges but does not appear to have been read. The spine lacks any creases. The original soundtrack order card is still in place at the center of the book. Pages are age toned but clean and unmarked.

(1982). First edition, first printing. Offsetting to the endpapers, minor spotting to the page edges, else near fine in gilt-lettered natural cloth shelfback over blue boards; in a near fine, lightly age-toned illustrated dust jacket mildly faded at the spine. Jacket painting by Paul Stinson. Hubbard's massive sf epic of Jonnie Goodboy Tyler and his battle against the oppressive alien race of the Psychlos. Memorably lensed with Barry Pepper as Jonnie and John Travolta as the evil Terl. "A masterpiece."--A.E. Van Vogt.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good +. First Edition/First Printing. A square solid tight clean un-read unused copy. The 24.00 jacket has some light edge wear else fine. A monster in size,with 800+ pages and NONE of the lean or reading wear usually associated with a book this size. Pretty nice copy for a 40 year old book. Great read. The basis for the terrible JohnTravolta movie. THIS COPY IS IN MY POSSESSION AND WILL NORMALLY SHIP NEXT DAY. Book.

First British edition (& 1st printing). SF novel, made into a dreadful film. This NEL proof is a modern rarity. New English Library (NEL) were to publish this first British edition and accordingly produced bound proofs (giving a publication date of 4th July 1983 on the front cover) - but at the last minute publication was cancelled and the book subsequently appeared from a different publisher - Quadrant Books - in 1984. Very uncommon item. Fine copy. Uncorrected book proof (trade paperback).

Octavo, blue wrappers printed in black. Advance copy (uncorrected proof) of the first edition. "Galactic goodies-versus-baddies. Hubbard's comeback novel after decades misspent as a religious prophet. Extremely long, and very old-fashioned, it has no virtues." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), p. 27. "There is a degree of badness that is not even funny . unremittingly dreadful." - Roz Kaveney, Foundation. The first part of the novel was adapted as a 2000 film starring (and partly financed by) John Travolta. Released to critical and commercial failure, "Battlefield Earth" is frequently described as one of the worst films of all time. Anatomy of Wonder (1987) 4-280. A fine copy. (#168801).

Octavo, printed blue wrappers. Advance copy (uncorrected proof) of the projected first British edition. "Galactic goodies-versus-baddies. Hubbard's comeback novel after decades misspent as a religious prophet. Extremely long, and very old-fashioned, it has no virtues." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), p. 27. "There is a degree of badness that is not even funny . unremittingly dreadful." - Roz Kaveney, Foundation. The first part of the novel was adapted as a 2000 film starring (and partly financed by) John Travolta. Released to critical and commercial failure, "Battlefield Earth" is frequently described as one of the worst films of all time. New English Library did not publish the novel due to a contractual dispute with Bridge Publications. The book was published in the UK in 1984 by Quadrant Books. Anatomy of Wonder (1987) 4-280. A fine copy. A scarce proof. (#168800).

Octavo, printed blue wrappers. "Galactic goodies-versus-baddies. Hubbard's comeback novel after decades misspent as a religious prophet. Extremely long, and very old-fashioned, it has no virtues." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), p. 27. "There is a degree of badness that is not even funny . unremittingly dreadful." - Roz Kaveney, Foundation. The first part of the novel was adapted as a 2000 film starring (and partly financed by) John Travolta. Released to critical and commercial failure, "Battlefield Earth" is frequently described as one of the worst films of all time. New English Library did not publish the novel due to a contractual dispute with Bridge Publications. The book was published in the UK in 1984 by Quadrant Books. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (1987) 4-280]. A fine copy. A scarce proof. (#168800) (29600) Advance copy (uncorrected proof) of the projected first British edition.

First British edition (& 1st printing). SF novel, made into a dreadful film. This NEL proof is s modern rarity. New English Library (NEL) were to publish this first British edition and accordingly produced bound proofs (giving a publication date of 4th July 1983 on the front cover) - but at the last minute publication was cancelled and the book subsequently appeared from a different publisher - Quadrant Books - in 1984. Very uncommon item. Sold together with a copy of the 1984 Quadrant UK hardcover edition (Fine copy in a Fine dustjacket). Fine (unread) copy. Uncorrected book proof (trade paperback).
